snippet: The exhibition “Max Weber on Long Island,” at the Heckscher Museum in Huntington, has 26 of his landscapes on display, and many had been in storage since his death.
abstract: Exhibition entitled Max Weber on Long Island, at the Heckscher Museum in Huntington, has 26 of Weber's landscapes on display, many of which have been in storage since his death (Metropolitan/Long Island). Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: HUNTINGTON, N.Y. MAX WEBER, an artist who was born in Russia, immigrated to New York as a child and studied with Matisse in Paris, lived on Long Island from 1921 until his death in 1961. He painted landscapes that included barns in Roslyn, the library cupola in Floral Park and industrial buildings in Sea Cliff.
